2T1.1.title: Tax Evasion; Willful Failure to File Return, Supply Information, or Pay Tax;

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is there a tax loss in this case?
Is the tax loss more than $3,500,000?
Is the tax loss more than $2,000,000 but not more than $3,500,000?

yesResult.description: Tax loss more than $2,000,000 but not more than $3,500,000

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the tax loss more than $1,500,000 but not more than $2,000,000?

yesResult.description: Tax loss more than $1,500,000 but not more than $2,000,000

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the tax loss more than $1,000,000 but not more than $1,500,000?

yesResult.description: Tax loss more than $1,000,000 but not more than $1,500,000

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the tax loss more than $550,000 but not more than $1,000,000?

yesResult.description: Tax loss more than $550,000 but not more than $1,000,000

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the tax loss more than $350,000 but not more than $550,000?

yesResult.description: Tax loss more than $350,000 but not more than $550,000

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the tax loss more than $200,000 but not more than $350,000?

yesResult.description: Tax loss more than $200,000 but not more than $350,000

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the tax loss more than $120,000 but not more than $200,000?

yesResult.description: Tax loss more than $120,000 but not more than $200,000

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the tax loss more than $80,000 but not more than $120,000?

yesResult.description: Tax loss more than $80,000 but not more than $120,000

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the tax loss more than $40,000 but not more than $80,000?

yesResult.description: Tax loss more than $40,000 but not more than $80,000

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant fail to report or correctly identify the source of income exceeding $10,000 in any year from criminal activity?

yesEffect.description: Failed to report or correctly identify source of income exceeding $10,000 from criminal activity

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve sophisticated means?

2T1.4.title: Aiding, Assisting, Procuring, Counseling, or Advising Tax Fraud

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is there a tax loss resulting from the defendant's aid, assistance, procurance, or advice?
What is the amount of the tax loss as defined in §2T1.1?

result.description: Level from Tax Table (§2T4.1) corresponding to the tax loss amount

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant commit the offense as part of a pattern/scheme from which they derived substantial income, or were they in the business of preparing tax returns?

yesEffect.description: Pattern/scheme with substantial income or tax preparer business

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve sophisticated means?

2T1.6.title: Failing to Collect or Truthfully Account for and Pay Over Tax

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the offense involve embezzlement by withholding tax from an employee's earnings and willfully failing to account to the employee for it?
Would applying §2B1.1 (Theft, Property Destruction, and Fraud) result in a higher offense level than the level from §2T4.1 (Tax Table)?

yesResult.description: Apply §2B1.1 (Theft, Property Destruction, and Fraud) for embezzlement of withheld taxes

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is there a tax amount that was not collected or accounted for and paid over?

yesResult.description: Level from §2T4.1 (Tax Table) corresponding to the tax not collected or accounted for and paid over

noResult.description: Level from §2T4.1 (Tax Table) for failure to collect, account for, or pay over tax

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Does the defendant derive a substantial portion of income from promoting tax schemes or regularly prepare/assist in tax return preparation for profit?
specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: If this enhancement applies, do not apply §3B1.3 (Abuse of Position of Trust or Use of Special Skill)

yesEffect.description: Defendant derives substantial income from promoting tax schemes or regularly prepares tax returns for profit

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve sophisticated means?

yesEffect.description: Offense involved especially complex or intricate conduct, such as hiding assets through fictitious entities, corporate shells, or offshore accounts

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the base offense level from §2T4.1 (Tax Table) corresponding to the amount not deposited minus 5 levels greater than 4?

yesResult.description: 5 less than the level from §2T4.1 (Tax Table) corresponding to the amount not deposited

2T1.9.title: Conspiracy to Impede, Impair, Obstruct, or Defeat Tax

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the offense level determined from §2T1.1 or §2T1.4 (as appropriate) greater than 10?

yesResult.description: Use offense level from §2T1.1 or §2T1.4 as appropriate

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve the planned or threatened use of violence to impede, impair, obstruct, or defeat the ascertainment, computation, assessment, or collection of revenue?

yesEffect.description: Planned or threatened violence to impede revenue collection

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the conduct intended to encourage persons other than or in addition to co-conspirators to violate the internal revenue laws or impede, impair, obstruct, or defeat the ascertainment, computation, assessment, or collection of revenue?

yesEffect.description: Conduct intended to encourage others to violate revenue laws

specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Do not apply if an adjustment from §2T1.4(b)(1) is applied

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Has the tax loss amount been determined?

noResult.description: Tax loss amount must be calculated to determine base offense level from Tax Table §2T4.1

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Should the base offense level be determined by consulting the Tax Table in §2T4.1 using the calculated tax loss amount?

yesResult.description: Base offense level corresponds to the tax loss amount as specified in the Tax Table at §2T4.1

noResult.description: Invalid path - base offense level must be determined from Tax Table §2T4.1

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the tax loss (amount of duty) exceed $1,500?

yesResult.description: Use the level from §2T4.1 Tax Table corresponding to the tax loss amount

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Did the tax loss (amount of duty) exceed $200?

yesResult.description: Tax loss exceeded $200 but did not exceed $1,500

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the offense involve sophisticated means?
